overview_of_class: Data analysis in the modern age requires familiarity of many concepts and methods from statistics. This course provides an introduction to the basics as well as exposure to some of the most advanced techniques. The emphasis will be on practical problems from physics and astronomy, rather than on theory or on statistical methods from other fields. Prior knowledge of statistics is not required. Homework assignments will require some numerical work on a computer.
name: Statistical Methods for Physicists and Astronomers
title: WCAS PHYSICS 441-0-1 Statistical Methods for Physicists and Astronomers

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Data analysis in the modern age requires familiarity of many concepts and methods from statistics. This course provides an introduction to the basics as well as exposure to some of the most advanced techniques. The emphasis will be on practical problems from physics and astronomy, rather than on theory or on statistical methods from other fields. Prior knowledge of statistics is not required. Homework assignments will require some numerical work on a computer.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Students should be able to write elementary computer programs
in python, C++, or C.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Students will be expected to understand what a probability density function is
and how to evaluate point estimators and confidence intervals. They should understand Bayes' Theorem
and grasp a variety of frequentist and Bayesian methods. They should be able to perform linear,
nonlinear, and multidimensional regression (e.g. curve fitting), and they should be comfortable with
Maximum Likelihood and Least Squares methods. They should understand hypothesis testing and
model selection.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
Lectures two or three times per week, with extensive worked problems
as homework.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Homework scores, one in-class midterm exam, and a final written project.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
There is one required textbook.

ISBN-13: 978-0198501558
